snippet: Painstaking analyses of fossils from the Permian extinction, 252 million years ago, are providing startling new clues to the behavior of modern marine life and its future.
abstract: Studies from Stanford and the University of California at Santa Cruz report that painstaking analyses of marine fossils from the Permian extinction 252 million years ago are providing a vital and unexpected understanding of modern marine life--and clues to its future.
lead_paragraph: Painstaking analyses of fossils from the Permian extinction, 252 million years ago, are providing startling new clues to the behavior of modern marine life and its future.

headline.seo: New Studies of Permian Extinction Shed Light on the ‘Great Dying’
headline.main: Life in the Sea Found Its Fate in a Paroxysm of Extinction
headline.print_headline: Life in the Sea Found Its Fate In a Paroxysm Of Extinction
